dct_title_s: [3d. Edn.] of Britton & Rey's map of the state of California
dct_description_sm: compiled from the U.S. Land & Coast Surveys, the several military, scientific & rail road explorations, the state & county boundary surveys made under the order of the Surveyor General of California, & from private surveys ; by George H. Goddard, C.E. Completed with additions & corrections up to the day of publication from the U.S. Land Office, & other reliable sources ; [engraved by H. Steinegger] ; lithy. of Britton & Rey. Montcomery St. cor. Commercial, S. F.
This is the second state of the 3d. Edn, the first stating "issued after the Adjournment of the Legislature 1858."

The western part of Nevada has been remapped as compared with 1st edition, but follows very closely the second edition. A significant addition is the notice of the silver discoveries: Virginia City and Gold Hill.
Relief shown by hachures and spot heights.
Coordinates approximate and based on Greenwich meridian.
Bar scale on map in "Statute Miles."
Shows topography, waterways, county boundaries, towns, ranchos, roads, trails, canals, ditches, and "mining places."
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Warren Heckrotte Map Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain.  There are no restrictions on use.  If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
